Gilberto,

This is a bug. It was found and fixed a while back, but either the bug  
fix didn't make it into the version posted on the web, or you installed  
an earlier version. In any case, I will be releasing a new version this  
week that will have this fixed and also will have a few new things. In  
the meantime, you can remove any line where 'reset' is being called on  
a MassFlowController object, or else edit file flowControllers.py to  
add a dummy 'reset' method to class MassFlowController.

Dave



On Friday, April 11, 2003, at 12:56 PM, gilberto_rozenchan wrote:

> I'm trying to use the MassFlowController between a reservoir and a
> reactor, but I keep getting the error message "MassFlowController
> instance has no attribute 'reset'", pointing to file Reactor.py as
> the source of the error. I tried removing the line "self.reset()"
> from the "install" definition at that file, but it doesn't seem to
> work.
>
> The reset function is only used for pressure regulators, which are
> disabled in the Reactor module. The above-mentioned problem also
> happens for Valves. What should I do to fix this?
>
> Gilberto
>
